results.title: The Frog prince (Muppets)
results.creator_credit: Jim Henson, Henson Associates and Robert Lawrence Productions
results.brief_description: Sir Robin, the bravest prince is turned into a frog by an ogre. The only cure to revert him to his human form is to receive a kiss from a Princess, to lift the spell. Starring Trudy Young as the Princess and Gordon Thomson as the Prince, as well as the muppet performers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Henson, Henson Associates and Robert Lawrence Productions

results.title: A Lesson for teacher
results.creator_credit: John Mansfield and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
In 1976 Dr Neville Bennett of Lancaster University published his research report evaluating the success and failure of various systems used in British primary schools. This was the first major attempt to analyse scientifically just how much children learn in establishments ranging from the most progressive, open-plan schools, to the most traditional. The publication of the report was an important educational event, and it will give rise to much questioning about the direction of current trends in British education. The report revealed that in one year pupils taught by formal methods can be as much as five months in advance educationally of those taught by the free style.

results.title: The Laws of the land
results.creator_credit: Tony Edwards and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
The application of scientific methods has increased crop and livestock yields in Britain by 50% since World War II. But some farmers are questioning the scientific approach and argue that the new methods may ultimately be self-defeating. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Killer in the village
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
An update of the 1983 Horizon report on the spread of AIDS in the United States of America and those groups most affected by the disease. Documents medical research in relation to AIDS and follows AIDS patients through various treatments. Highlights the lifestyle changes initiated in the homosexual community. Some of the ideas expressed in this video have changed in light of recent research into AIDS.

results.title: The French lieutenant's woman (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Karel Reisz, Leon Clore and Juniper Films
results.brief_description: Based on the brilliant novel by John Fowles, with the screenplay written by Harold Pinter, “The French Lieutenant’s Woman” is both a classic Victorian love story and an ironic look at an age of double-standard morality. Sarah Woodruff’s chance meeting with Charles Smithson, a young man-about-town who subsequently discards his pretty young fiancee in a wave of passion, sets in motion a series of events that disrupts the quiet fishing and seaside village in England, and profoundly affects the lives of its residents.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karel Reisz, Leon Clore and Juniper Films
results.description: Based on the brilliant novel by John Fowles, with the screenplay written by Harold Pinter, “The French Lieutenant’s Woman” is both a classic Victorian love story and an ironic look at an age of double-standard morality. Sarah Woodruff’s chance meeting with Charles Smithson, a young man-about-town who subsequently discards his pretty young fiancee in a wave of passion, sets in motion a series of events that disrupts the quiet fishing and seaside village in England, and profoundly affects the lives of its residents.
description_for_label: Based on the brilliant novel by John Fowles, with the screenplay written by Harold Pinter, “The French Lieutenant’s Woman” is both a classic Victorian love story and an ironic look at an age of double-standard morality. Sarah Woodruff’s chance meeting with Charles Smithson, a young man-about-town who subsequently discards his pretty young fiancee in a wave of passion, sets in motion a series of events that disrupts the quiet fishing and seaside village in England, and profoundly affects the lives of its residents.

results.title: Invasion of the virions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Investigates the different sorts of virions, where they come, and why they succeed in taking over so completely. Why they are so difficult to fight and how do the virions manage to hide away in the body only to re-emerge later.

results.title: We all have tales
results.creator_credit: C W Rogers, Ken Hoin and Rabbit Ears Productions
results.brief_description: This multi-award winning series is a celebration of musical and cultural traditions around the world. The series features narration and music by world-famous performers.
